intro: Cloezia, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to South America. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. They produce small, yellow flowers that develop into distinctive, inflated seed pods. Cloezia species are often found in grasslands and open areas, thriving in temperate climates.
